botanical_details.genus: Viola can be annuals, biennials or deciduous or evergreen perennials, with simple or pinnately lobed leaves and 5-petalled flowers of characteristic shape
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Violets are stoloniferous perennials with small, highly fragrant, self-coloured purple, blue or white flowers in late winter and early spring

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in fertile, humus-rich, moist but well-drained, neutral to alkaline soil. Ideally choose a position with winter sun and summer shade, such as under deciduous trees, shrubs or hedges
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by stem cuttings in spring or late summer, or by division in spring or autumn
how_to_grow.pruning: Deadhead to prolong flowering. After flowering cut back vigorous plants to keep compact
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to slugs, snails, glasshouse red spider mite and violet gall midge
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to powdery mildews, pansy downy mildew, pansy leaf spot, a virus and a rust
